data.title: Dark Matter ALBUM REVIEW by one of the faithful
data.meta_description: Hey friends, I've been absorbing dark matter since yesterday and have written a relatively in depth review for the website 13th Floor.
data.text:
Overall that sounds pretty positive. In line with most other reviews. Something Special seems to be a divisive type of track. This one sounds like it‚Äôs going to be the Buckle Up, Sleeping by Myself track of Dark Matter.

Melbourne #1 '98

Melbourne #2 '03

Melbourne #3 '03

Melbourne #1 '06

Melbourne #3 '06

Melbourne '09

Melbourne '14

0

BrainofBGA said:

Something Special seems to be a divisive type of track. This one sounds like it‚Äôs going to be the Buckle Up, Sleeping by Myself track of Dark Matter.

Totally right. I hope some folks end up digging something special, my response to it was so visceral and surprising to me that it made the track seem objectively bad. Hopefully I'll be proved wrong if others enjoy it. I absolutely loved Buckle Up, yet many still hate that track with a passion!!

0

BrainofBGA said:

Overall that sounds pretty positive. In line with most other reviews. Something Special seems to be a divisive type of track. This one sounds like it‚Äôs going to be the Buckle Up, Sleeping by Myself track of Dark Matter.

You're right that those tracks are divisive, but it sounds to me more like "Something Special" is thematically in line with "Just Breathe," "Future Days," "The End" and "Sirens"-- emotional Ed songs about his wife and/or daughters that feel out of place on Pearl Jam albums (less so for "Sirens," in my opinion). (It's not clear to me whether "Sleeping By Myself" is autobiographical in the same way as those songs.)

I gather speed from you fucking with me.

0

I think my problem with the album although only heard it once was it has no flow. First 4 or 5 can't recall but those first ones fit together then it becomes all over the place and I know I've said it before so apologies like the last few records it has some that left me thinking how did that make the cut.

BF25394 said:

BrainofBGA said:

Overall that sounds pretty positive. In line with most other reviews. Something Special seems to be a divisive type of track. This one sounds like it‚Äôs going to be the Buckle Up, Sleeping by Myself track of Dark Matter.

You're right that those tracks are divisive, but it sounds to me more like "Something Special" is thematically in line with "Just Breathe," "Future Days," "The End" and "Sirens"-- emotional Ed songs about his wife and/or daughters that feel out of place on Pearl Jam albums (less so for "Sirens," in my opinion). (It's not clear to me whether "Sleeping By Myself" is autobiographical in the same way as those songs.)

Yes, I forgot about Future Days in particular. Think that one is quite divisive. I don‚Äôt mind Just Breathe and The End. But Future Days‚Ä¶üòè

I was thinking Sleeping was quite divisive, not so much for its theme, but more so it place on a PJ album. Considering it was already an Ed solo track that got re-recorded into a PJ tune.

dwjmu84 said:

SBM had no business on LB; its inclusion, along with a closer the likes of future days, took the album to a low point in the band‚Äôs career in terms of quality.

I agree re:SBM. It's a cheesier version of an already released song. Weird choice. Can't wait to hear the album myself, but I suspect there will be a few skipped songs for me after time, usually is. And that bit of Something Special we heard on that tweet....I bet it gets to skip status faster than most.

hippiemom = goodness

0

if its justt 1 or 2 that arent up to par, thats pretty good...always find it funny thats what constantly gets focused on here

always

Some of the greatest albums of all time have 1 or 2 or more whatever songs

0

If upon releasing their 12th album, only 1 or 2 songs on it are going to be questionable to some fans, it sounds to me like they did a good job. There aren't a lot of artists that can match that. Looking forward to hearing them in a few weeks.

0

lastexitlondon said:

I say 4

Which four in your opinion?

Also, if I recall, you had one listen to this record, which was highly affected by the atmosphere. I think you even admitted that there was quite a bit you could not remember. Having said that, which songs did you not enjoy on first "listen"?

0

Which four in your opinion?

Also, if I recall, you had one listen to this record, which was highly affected by the atmosphere. I think you even admitted that there was quite a bit you could not remember. Having said that, which songs did you not enjoy on first "listen"?

Agreed but as I was listening I recall thinking I didn't like the second half . Scared of fear. React respond. I liked instantly.

Dark matter I love. Waiting for stevie was ok. But I didn't like something special and the last song. Inbetween were not for me is all I thought. They maybe for you or others but I was led to believe it's a heavy album and apart from 5 songs. It's not. Only in my opinion. Of course

So Something Special is this albums The End lyric-wise

No it's a sentimental love of a child and letting them go into the world kind of thing. As a parent I get it but as a pearl jam song. It doesn't fit

Am I the only person who just feels like the ‚Äúcool‚Äù kids are not gonna like Something Special even if it‚Äôs a good song- catchy melody, light hearted, fun. The writer must not be a parent.

You are the only one cutting people down for their opinions on a subjective matter on a subject that hasn't even happened yet, that's for sure.

I am a parent, will wait to listen to the whole song but that bit on twitter/X wasn't doing it for me at all. That said, I love Buckle up, Just Breathe, and even the End. So who the hells knows.
